questions.question: Why must the fishermen wake before sunrise? (Variant 51)
questions.answer: To enjoy calm tides and catch fish early.

questions.question: What does the wind signal in the poem? (Variant 52)
questions.answer: It signals the start of the fishing day.

questions.question: Why are the fishermen fearless? (Variant 53)
questions.answer: They are brave and accustomed to the ocean.

questions.question: What is meant by 'leaping wealth'? (Variant 54)
questions.answer: The fish that bring livelihood and fortune.

questions.question: How does the poet show unity among fishermen? (Variant 55)
questions.answer: They are called brothers and work together.

questions.question: Why is the sea called the mother? (Variant 56)
questions.answer: It feeds, protects and shelters them.

questions.question: How does nature guide the fishermen? (Variant 57)
questions.answer: Wind and waves direct and warn them.

questions.question: What do the fishermen value most? (Variant 58)
questions.answer: Family, livelihood and the sea.

questions.question: Why is the dawn important in the poem? (Variant 59)
questions.answer: It marks a fresh start for discovery and sailing.

questions.question: How is the sea both home and work? (Variant 60)
questions.answer: They fish there, live near it and depend on it.

questions.question: Explain how the poem celebrates the bond between fishermen and the sea. (Insight 151)
questions.answer: The sea is shown as mother, home and protector while fishermen trust and respect it.

questions.question: Discuss the use of imagery and sound in the poem. (Insight 152)
questions.answer: Words like dawn, sleeping waves and roaring waters create vivid pictures and musical rhythm.

questions.question: How does the poem show courage and adventure? (Insight 153)
questions.answer: The call to venture into deep waters shows bravery and excitement rather than fear.

questions.question: Explain how the natural world becomes a guide in the poem. (Insight 154)
questions.answer: Wind, tide and waves signal movement, time and safety, guiding the fishermen.

questions.question: What message does the poem give to its readers? (Insight 155)
questions.answer: The poem inspires unity, courage and respect for nature as life partner and provider.
